title: Betsy DeVos Had Millions of Dollars in Private Transactions in June and July
text:
Text size

U.S. Education Secretary Elisabeth “Betsy” DeVos this week disclosed millions of dollars in recent financial transactions in entities that are not publicly traded.

DeVos reported four transactions dating from June and July to the U.S. Office of Government Ethics on July 25. Her filing received a third and final regulatory approval on Sept. 12. It was then publicly posted to the OGE site.

DeVos didn’t respond to a request made to her office for comment on her transactions.

On June 27, DeVos sold $250,001 to $500,000 of an investment in BDT Capital Partners Oak Co-Invest, a Cayman Islands-incorporated entity that provides specialty coffee beverages and accessories. Her disclosure form for calendar 2018 showed that Devos owned an investment in BDT Capital Partners Oak valued at $5 million to $25 million. Specific values aren’t required for disclosure, only ranges.

The entity may involve Chicago investment firm BDT Capital Partners. BDT didn’t return a phone call seeking comment on the transaction.

Read more: DeVos Discloses May Private Financial Transactions

On July 12, DeVos sold more than $1 million in interests in SI Holdings, a maker of “custom natural and synthetic rubber products and composite structures and tooling for aerospace, defense, and select industrial applications,” according to OGE records. More information about SI Holdings couldn’t be learned.

Editor's Choice

That sale may represent her entire interests in SI Holdings. Her 2018 disclosure form noted that Devos owned more than $1 million in interests in SI Holdings.

On July 23, Devos sold $1 million to $5 million in interests in PHC LLC, a holding company operated by EDP Management LLC, which itself is an entity that invests the assets of Devos’ mother, Elsa Prince Broekhuizen.

That sale may represent all of the education secretary’s interests in PHC LLC. Her investment in the holding company was valued at $1 million to $5 million at the end of 2018.

Wingspan LLC was among the entities that PHC LLC wholly owned at the end of 2018, but Devos disclosed that on July 23 she bought $250,001 to $500,000 in interests in Wingspan. Wingspan owns a Falcon 2000 aircraft. According to a registry with the Federal Aviation Administration, the aircraft that Wingspan owns was built in 1995.

EDP Management didn’t respond to a request for comment on Devos’ transactions and the status of the ownership of Wingspan.

Inside Scoop is a regular Barron’s feature covering stock transactions by corporate executives and board members—so-called insiders—as well as large shareholders, politicians, and other prominent figures. Due to their insider status, these investors are required to disclose stock trades with the Securities and Exchange Commission or other regulatory groups.

description: The U.S. education secretary sold $1 million to $5 million in interests in an entity affiliated with her mother. DeVos also invested in a limited-liability company that owns a Falcon 2000 aircraft.
